Package squidpony.squidgrid.gui.gdx

Class LinesPanel<T extends com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color>

java.lang.Object
com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Actor
squidpony.squidgrid.gui.gdx.LinesPanel<T>
Type Parameters:
T - 
public class LinesPanel<T extends com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color>
extends com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Actor
An actor capable of drawing IColoredStrings. It is lines-oriented: putting a line may erase a line put before. It is designed to write text with a variable-width font (as opposed to SquidPanel). It performs line wrapping by default. It can write from top to bottom or from bottom to top (the default).

This tweet shows an example. The panel at the top of the screenshot is implemented using this class (with drawBottomUp being true).

This class is usually used as follows: 

 final int nbLines = LinesPanel.computeMaxLines(font, pixelHeight);
 final LinesPanel lp = new LinesPanel(new GDXMarkup(), font, nbLines);
 lp.setSize(pixelWidth, pixelHeight);
 stage.addActor(lp);

Contrary to SquidMessageBox, this panel doesn't support scrolling (for now). So it's suited when it is fine forgetting old messages (as in brogue's messages area).

Author:
smelC
See Also:
An alternative, doing similar lines-drawing business, but being backed up by .

      public float xOffset
      The horizontal offset to use when writing. If you aren't doing anything weird, should be left to 0.

      The vertical offset to use when writing. If you aren't doing anything weird, should be left to 0.

    • drawBottomUp

      public boolean drawBottomUp
      If true, draws: 
       ...
 content[1]
 content[0]
      If false, draws: 
       content[0]
 content[1]
 ...

  • Constructor Details

    • LinesPanel

      public LinesPanel​(squidpony.panel.IMarkup<T> markup, com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.BitmapFont font, int maxLines)
      Parameters:
      markup - The markup to use, or null if none. You likely want to give GDXMarkup. If non-null, markup will be enabled in font.
      font - The font to use.
      maxLines - The maximum number of lines that this panel should display. Must be >= 0.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - If maxLines < 0

    • LinesPanel

      public LinesPanel​(squidpony.panel.IMarkup<T> markup, TextCellFactory font, int maxLines)
      Parameters:
      markup - The markup to use, or null if none. You likely want to give GDXMarkup. If non-null, markup will be enabled in font.
      font - The font to use as a TextCellFactory, typically for distance field fonts.
      maxLines - The maximum number of lines that this panel should display. Must be >= 0.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - If maxLines < 0

      Used to help find the last parameter to give the constructor of this class.
      Parameters:
      font - the font being used
      height - the height of the area you want to put text into
      Returns:
      The last argument to give to LinesPanel(IMarkup, BitmapFont, int) when the desired pixel height is height

    • draw

      public void draw​(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Batch batch, float parentAlpha)
      Draws this LinesPanel using the given Batch.
      This will set the shader of batch if using a distance field or MSDF font and the shader is currently not configured for such a font; it does not reset the shader to the default so that multiple Actors can all use the same shader and so specific extra glyphs or other items can be rendered after calling draw(). If you need to draw both a distance field font and full-color art, you should set the shader on the Batch to null when you want to draw full-color art, and end the Batch between drawing this object and the other art.
      Overrides:
      draw in class com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Actor
      Parameters:
      batch - a Batch such as a FilterBatch that must be between a begin() and end() call; usually done by Stage
      parentAlpha - currently ignored

    • clearArea

      protected void clearArea​(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Batch batch)
      Paints this panel with clearingColor

    • transform

      protected squidpony.panel.IColoredString<T> transform​(squidpony.panel.IColoredString<T> ics, int ydx)
      If you want to grey out "older" messages, you would do it in this method, when ydx > 0 (using an IColorCenter maybe ?).
      Parameters:
      ics - an IColoredString with the same generic color type as this LinesPanel
      ydx - The index of ics within content.
      Returns:
      A variation of ics, or ics itself.
